leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 神经科学-神经影像与连接组生态
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 预处理→配准→连接组→统计→评测
leaf_cluster.tool_form: pipelines + 图分析 + 可视化

queries: [WEB] brain network graph analysis python github

tools.name: MNE-Preprocessing
tools.one_line_profile: Preprocessing pipeline for artifact reduction in EEG data
tools.detailed_description: A Python repository providing step-by-step approaches to reduce artifacts in electroencephalographic (EEG) raw data, serving as a preprocessing workflow wrapper around MNE.

tools.name: conpy
tools.one_line_profile: Power mapping and functional connectivity analysis using DICS
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for performing power mapping and functional connectivity analysis on neuroimaging data using Dynamic Imaging of Coherent Sources (DICS) beamforming.

tools.name: PyEEGLab
tools.one_line_profile: Library for analyzing and manipulating EEG data
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed for the analysis and manipulation of Electroencephalography (EEG) data, offering tools for feature extraction and signal processing.

tools.name: NetworkToolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Methods and measures for brain and psychometric network analysis
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing methods and measures for analyzing brain, cognitive, and psychometric networks, including tools for network construction and graph theoretical analysis.

tools.name: asap-modules
tools.one_line_profile: Image processing modules for EM connectomics and Array Tomography
tools.detailed_description: A collection of render-based image processing modules for Electron Microscopy (EM) connectomics and Array Tomography, developed by the Allen Institute.

tools.name: NeuroGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarks for Graph Machine Learning in Brain Connectomics
tools.detailed_description: A library and benchmark suite for Graph Machine Learning (GML) applied to brain connectomics, providing datasets and baseline models for neuroimaging graph analysis.

tools.name: Graph_Sampling
tools.one_line_profile: Graph sampling algorithms for large-scale graph analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python package implementing various graph sampling approaches to reduce graph size while preserving structural properties, useful for analyzing large connectome graphs.

tools.name: AIDAconnect
tools.one_line_profile: Mouse brain network analysis for rs-fMRI and DTI data
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox for the analysis of mouse brain networks using resting-state fMRI and Diffusion Tensor Imaging (DTI) data, employing graph theory metrics.

tools.name: lightflow
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight distributed workflow system for scientific pipelines
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, distributed workflow system designed for managing complex scientific data processing pipelines, developed by the Australian Synchrotron.

tools.name: BlueCelluLab
tools.one_line_profile: Biologically detailed neural network simulations API
tools.detailed_description: A Python API for setting up and running biologically detailed neural network simulations and analysis, part of the Blue Brain Project ecosystem.

tools.name: CoreNeuron
tools.one_line_profile: Optimized simulator for large-scale neural networks
tools.detailed_description: A compute engine for the NEURON simulator, optimized for memory efficiency and speed to enable large-scale neural network simulations.

tools.name: snap
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation and Network Analysis Productivity layer
tools.detailed_description: The Blue Brain Pythonic Simulation and Network Analysis Productivity layer (SNAP), providing high-level interfaces for analyzing neural simulations and network properties.

tools.name: findr
tools.one_line_profile: Flow-field Inference from Neural Data using Recurrent networks
tools.detailed_description: A tool for inferring flow fields and dynamics from neural data using deep recurrent neural networks, enabling the modeling of neural population dynamics.

tools.name: CAVEclient
tools.one_line_profile: Client for Connectome Annotation Versioning Engine (CAVE)
tools.detailed_description: A Python client for accessing and interacting with the REST APIs of the Connectome Annotation Versioning Engine (CAVE), facilitating connectomics data management.

tools.name: PyChunkedGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Backend for fast proofreading of connectomics segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A data backend designed for fast, interactive proofreading and editing of cell segmentations in large-scale connectomics datasets.

tools.name: CM-graph
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for multichannel EEG-EMG connectivity analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolbox extending MNE-Python for multichannel EEG-EMG connectivity analysis, focusing on graph and network theory applications for clinical markers.

tools.name: ActflowToolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Brain Activity Flow (Actflow) analysis toolbox
tools.detailed_description: A toolbox to quantify the relationship between brain connectivity and task activity through network simulations and machine learning prediction, helping determine causal contributions of connections.

tools.name: ColeAnticevicNetPartition
tools.one_line_profile: Cole-Anticevic Brain-wide Network Partition (CAB-NP)
tools.detailed_description: The public release of the Cole-Anticevic Brain-wide Network Partition (CAB-NP), providing a whole-brain functional network atlas and associated data.

tools.name: STREAM-4D
tools.one_line_profile: Surface to Tractography Real-time EEG Activation Mapping
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for 4D visualization and mapping of EEG activation onto brain surface and tractography in real-time or offline modes.

tools.name: RegressionDynamicCausalModeling.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Directed connectivity estimation in whole-brain networks
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for estimating directed functional connectivity in whole-brain networks using regression-based Dynamic Causal Modeling (rDCM).

tools.name: dcan_bold_processing
tools.one_line_profile: Functional connectivity preprocessing for fMRI
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox for post-processing resting-state fMRI data to compute functional connectivity, designed as part of the DCAN Labs pipeline.

tools.name: UNRAVEL
tools.one_line_profile: Tractography-based microstructure analysis tool
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool implementing the UNRAVEL method (UtiliziNg tRActography to uncoVEr muLti-fixel microstructure) for analyzing microstructural properties along white matter tracts.

tools.name: UTracto
tools.one_line_profile: Tracking of sub-cortical U-Fibers
tools.detailed_description: A Python package specifically designed to facilitate the tractography and tracking of short-range sub-cortical U-fibers in the brain.

tools.name: kglab
tools.one_line_profile: Abstraction layer for Graph Data Science and Knowledge Graphs
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing an abstraction layer for building and analyzing knowledge graphs, integrating various graph libraries (NetworkX, RDFlib, etc.) for scientific graph data science.

tools.name: karawun
tools.one_line_profile: Convert tractography to DICOM for navigation
tools.detailed_description: A tool to convert tractography files (from MRtrix etc.) into DICOM format, enabling their use in neurosurgical navigation software.

tools.name: nitools
tools.one_line_profile: Basic Neuroimaging utility functions extending nibabel and nilearn
tools.detailed_description: A collection of basic neuroimaging functions and utilities that are missing from standard libraries like nibabel and nilearn, developed by the Diedrichsen Lab.

tools.name: DMRITool
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for reconstruction, processing and visualization of diffusion MRI data
tools.detailed_description: An open source C++ toolbox designed for the reconstruction, processing, and visualization of diffusion MRI data, including DWI, tensor, ODF, EAP, and fiber tracking.

tools.name: OpenMuse
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface for recording and streaming Muse S Athena EEG signals
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool to record and stream EEG signals from Muse S Athena devices, facilitating data acquisition for neuroscience research.

tools.name: spectral_connectivity
tools.one_line_profile: Frequency domain connectivity analysis tools for electrophysiological data
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for multitaper spectral estimation and computation of functional and directed connectivity measures (coherence, Granger causality) in the frequency domain.

tools.name: ERP_Connectivity_EMG_Analysis
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB Toolbox for motor cortex signal processing and connectivity
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox implementing methods for ERP estimation, Cortical Functional Connectivity analysis, and EMG quantification for investigating the human motor cortex.

tools.name: HCP-Tractography
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for tractography reconstruction from Human Connectome Project data
tools.detailed_description: A Dipy-based pipeline designed for the reconstruction and tracking of tractography specifically for the Human Connectome Project (HCP) dataset.

tools.name: tractome
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive 3D tool for exploration and segmentation of tractography data
tools.detailed_description: An interactive 3D visualization and segmentation tool for tractography data, allowing users to explore brain connections.

tools.name: dFCwalk
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for dynamic Functional Connectivity analyses using random walks
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox for performing dynamic Functional Connectivity (dFC) analyses based on random walk descriptions.

tools.name: PyCartool
tools.one_line_profile: Python I/O interface for Cartool neuroimaging software
tools.detailed_description: An open-source Python package facilitating data input/output operations between the Cartool software and Python environments.

tools.name: cdlib
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive library for community discovery in complex networks
tools.detailed_description: A powerful Python library dedicated to community detection in graphs, widely used in connectomics and network neuroscience for analyzing brain modularity.

tools.name: ndlib
tools.one_line_profile: Library for modeling diffusion dynamics on networks
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for simulating diffusion models (e.g., epidemics, opinion dynamics) on networks, applicable to modeling signal propagation in brain networks.

tools.name: FusionNet-Pytorch
tools.one_line_profile: Deep residual CNN implementation for connectomics image segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of FusionNet, a deep fully residual convolutional neural network designed for high-accuracy image segmentation in connectomics (EM data).

tools.name: MULAN
tools.one_line_profile: Systematic framework for functional connectivity measures
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB framework designed to evaluate and apply various functional connectivity measures to neuroimaging data.

tools.name: Janelia Workstation
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated software platform for managing and visualizing large-scale neuro data
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive workstation software developed by Janelia Research Campus for the management, visualization, and analysis of large-scale neuroscience data.

tools.name: SNN
tools.one_line_profile: Library for Spiking Neural Network models and synapses
tools.detailed_description: A repository implementing various neuron models, synapses, and Spiking Neural Networks (SNN), serving as a library for computational neuroscience modeling.

tools.name: KUL_FWT
tools.one_line_profile: Automated tractography pipeline using MRTrix3 and FreeSurfer
tools.detailed_description: An automated workflow for performing tractography using MRTrix3 CSD, integrating subject-specific parcellations from FreeSurfer and MultiScaleBrainParcellator.

tools.name: benchmark_rsfMRI_prediction
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking scripts for resting-state fMRI predictive modeling
tools.detailed_description: A set of reusable scripts and benchmarks for performing predictive modeling on resting-state fMRI datasets, facilitating method comparison.

tools.name: Slicer-DTI-ALPS
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Slicer module for DTI-ALPS analysis
tools.detailed_description: A 3D Slicer extension module to calculate the Diffusion Tensor Image Analysis along the Perivascular Space (DTI-ALPS) index.

tools.name: esinet
tools.one_line_profile: EEG inverse solution solver using artificial neural networks
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that implements artificial neural networks for solving the EEG inverse problem (source localization). It is designed to integrate seamlessly with MNE-Python data structures, allowing researchers to apply deep learning methods to electromagnetic source imaging.

tools.name: MITK-Diffusion
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive toolkit for diffusion MRI analysis
tools.detailed_description: An official component of the Medical Imaging Interaction Toolkit (MITK) specifically designed for the analysis of diffusion-weighted MRI data. It provides a wide range of algorithms for reconstruction, tractography, and visualization of diffusion data.

tools.name: BrainSpace
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for gradient analysis of neuroimaging and connectomics data
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive toolbox for the identification and analysis of macroscale gradients in neuroimaging and connectomics datasets. It supports surface data visualization and gradient estimation, available for both Python and MATLAB environments.

tools.name: ENIGMA Toolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for accessing and analyzing ENIGMA consortium data
tools.detailed_description: An open-source repository facilitating access to over 100 ENIGMA statistical maps. It provides tools for visualizing cortical and subcortical surface data and relating neuroimaging findings to micro- and macroscale brain organization.

tools.name: micaopen
tools.one_line_profile: Processing pipelines and scripts from MICA Lab
tools.detailed_description: A collection of open scripts and processing pipelines developed by the Multimodal Imaging and Connectome Analysis (MICA) Lab. It includes workflows for multimodal imaging processing and connectome construction.

tools.name: MRtrix3
tools.one_line_profile: Advanced tools for diffusion MRI analysis and tractography
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive set of tools for advanced diffusion MRI analyses. It features constrained spherical deconvolution (CSD), probabilistic tractography, track-density imaging, and apparent fibre density quantification.

tools.name: SMRD
tools.one_line_profile: Robust MRI reconstruction using diffusion models
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of SURE-based Robust MRI Reconstruction with Diffusion Models. It leverages generative diffusion models to perform high-quality reconstruction of MRI images, serving as a solver for inverse problems in medical imaging.

tools.name: FLUX
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for MEG data analysis using MNE-Python
tools.detailed_description: A structured pipeline for the analysis of Magnetoencephalography (MEG) data. It is built on top of MNE-Python and provides a standardized workflow for processing and analyzing neuronal oscillation data.

tools.name: SpectraVis
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive visualization for functional brain networks
tools.detailed_description: A web-based interactive tool for analyzing and visualizing task-related functional networks in the brain over time and frequency domains. It aids in the exploration of dynamic connectivity patterns.

tools.name: OpenMAP-T1
tools.one_line_profile: Whole brain segmentation and parcellation tool for T1 MRI
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based tool for whole-brain segmentation and parcellation using the OpenMAP-T1 method on 3D T1-weighted MRI scans. It facilitates structural analysis of brain anatomy.

tools.name: PyTorch Connectomics
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning toolbox for EM connectomics segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch-based toolbox designed for semantic and instance segmentation in Electron Microscopy (EM) connectomics. It provides scalable and flexible implementations for processing large-scale nanometer-resolution neural data.

tools.name: NIAK
tools.one_line_profile: Neuroimaging analysis kit for fMRI connectivity
tools.detailed_description: A library for Octave (and MATLAB) focused on the preprocessing and analysis of functional MRI data. It is particularly tailored for connectivity analysis in large fMRI datasets.

tools.name: Spyker
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance Spiking Neural Networks (SNN) library
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance library for simulating Spiking Neural Networks, written from scratch with C++ core and Python interfaces, designed for computational neuroscience modeling.

tools.name: Brain-Midline-Detection
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning model for brain midline delineation
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a Context-Aware Refinement Network incorporating structural connectivity priors for precise brain midline delineation in neuroimaging data.

tools.name: 3D Slicer
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive platform for medical image visualization and analysis
tools.detailed_description: A multi-platform, free open-source software platform for visualization, processing, and analysis of medical computing and image data, supporting a vast ecosystem of extensions.

tools.name: DFC (Deep Fiber Clustering)
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning framework for tractography parcellation
tools.detailed_description: An anatomically informed fiber clustering tool using self-supervised deep learning for fast and effective parcellation of white matter tractography.

tools.name: SlicerDMRI
tools.one_line_profile: Diffusion MRI analysis extension for 3D Slicer
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive extension for 3D Slicer providing tools for diffusion MRI analysis, tractography, and visualization of white matter connections.

tools.name: SupWMA
tools.one_line_profile: Superficial White Matter Analysis tool
tools.detailed_description: A point-cloud-based deep learning framework with supervised contrastive learning for consistent tractography parcellation of superficial white matter across populations.

tools.name: TractCloud
tools.one_line_profile: Registration-free tractography parcellation tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool for registration-free tractography parcellation utilizing a novel local-global streamline point cloud representation.

tools.name: WhiteMatterAnalysis
tools.one_line_profile: White matter tractography clustering and analysis library
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for white matter tractography clustering, atlas creation, and groupwise analysis of diffusion MRI data.

tools.name: SyConn
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for volume EM synaptic connectome analysis
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for the generation and analysis of volume electron microscopy-based synaptic connectomes of brain tissue, handling large-scale dense reconstruction data.

tools.name: Tractify
tools.one_line_profile: Tractography pipeline for preprocessed DWIs
tools.detailed_description: A streamlined tractography pipeline designed to work with preprocessed diffusion weighted images (DWIs), facilitating connectome generation.

tools.name: Weighted-SC-Networks
tools.one_line_profile: Brain connectivity analysis and MRI processing package
tools.detailed_description: A package for brain connectivity analysis coupled with a multi-modal MRI processing pipeline, focusing on weighted structural connectivity networks.

tools.name: ScaffoldGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Cheminformatics library for scaffold network analysis
tools.detailed_description: An open-source cheminformatics library built on RDKit and NetworkX for generating and analyzing scaffold networks and trees from chemical datasets.

tools.name: NeuroGNN
tools.one_line_profile: Graph Neural Network framework for seizure detection
tools.detailed_description: A framework employing dynamic Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) to capture spatial, temporal, and semantic correlations in EEG data for precise seizure detection and classification.

tools.name: SLAVV (Vectorization-Public)
tools.one_line_profile: Software for vectorization and analysis
tools.detailed_description: Public repository for SLAVV software, providing tools for vectorization and analysis of scientific data (specifics implied by lab context).

tools.name: Compresso
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient compression for connectomics segmentation data
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library and tool for efficient compression of large-scale segmentation data, specifically optimized for connectomics datasets.

tools.name: HCP Pipelines
tools.one_line_profile: Standard processing pipelines for Human Connectome Project data
tools.detailed_description: The official set of processing pipelines for the Human Connectome Project (HCP), including structural, functional, and diffusion MRI preprocessing and analysis.

tools.name: PyVis
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive network graph visualization library
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for creating and visualizing interactive network graphs, widely used for exploring connectivity data in scientific research.

tools.name: Node-Parcellation
tools.one_line_profile: Individualized state-specific brain parcellation tool
tools.detailed_description: Code to generate individualized, state-specific node-level parcellations of the human brain, accounting for state-dependent functional organization.

tools.name: Feabas
tools.one_line_profile: Finite-Element Assisted Brain Assembly System
tools.detailed_description: A system for stitching and aligning connectomics data using finite-element methods, designed for large-scale brain assembly.

tools.name: nx_altair
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive NetworkX graph plotting with Altair
tools.detailed_description: A library that enables drawing interactive NetworkX graphs using the Altair visualization library, facilitating data exploration.

tools.name: Neurite
tools.one_line_profile: Neural networks toolbox for medical image analysis
tools.detailed_description: A neural networks toolbox focused on medical image analysis, providing layers and utilities for registration, segmentation, and synthesis.

tools.name: bctpy
tools.one_line_profile: Brain Connectivity Toolbox for Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Brain Connectivity Toolbox (BCT), providing complex network measures for characterizing brain connectivity datasets.

tools.name: Predictive Forward-Forward
tools.one_line_profile: Implementation of predictive forward-forward algorithm
tools.detailed_description: A simulation and implementation of the predictive forward-forward credit assignment algorithm for training neurobiologically-plausible recurrent neural network models.

tools.name: NetRep
tools.one_line_profile: Metrics for comparing network representations
tools.detailed_description: A library providing methods for comparing network representations, useful in deep learning and neuroscience for analyzing neural population codes.

tools.name: Effective Connectivity Toolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for computing effective brain connectivity
tools.detailed_description: Scripts and tools for computing effective connectivity using functional and structural MRI data, implementing constrained autoregressive models.

tools.name: MI-EEG-1D-CNN
tools.one_line_profile: 1D-CNN model for EEG motor imagery classification
tools.detailed_description: A robust implementation of a 1D Convolutional Neural Network for classifying motor imagery brain states from EEG data, serving as a reference model.

tools.name: dotmotif
tools.one_line_profile: A powerful query framework to search for network motifs in large graphs
tools.detailed_description: dotmotif is a framework for searching for subgraph isomorphisms (motifs) in large graphs using a domain-specific language. It is designed for connectomics and neuroscience applications to identify structural patterns in brain networks.

tools.name: grand-cypher
tools.one_line_profile: Cypher query language implementation for NetworkX graphs
tools.detailed_description: Grand Cypher allows users to query NetworkX graphs using the Cypher query language, facilitating complex pattern matching and data retrieval in graph-based scientific analysis, particularly in connectomics.

tools.name: grandiso-networkx
tools.one_line_profile: Performant subgraph isomorphism and monomorphism search for NetworkX
tools.detailed_description: A pure-Python implementation for fast subgraph isomorphism search, optimized for finding motifs in network data such as brain connectomes.

tools.name: Clinica
tools.one_line_profile: Software platform for clinical neuroimaging studies
tools.detailed_description: Clinica is a software platform that makes clinical neuroimaging research easier and reproducible. It provides processing pipelines for MRI and PET data, involving feature extraction and statistics/machine learning.

tools.name: Arbor
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance multi-compartment neural network simulation library
tools.detailed_description: Arbor is a library for simulating networks of morphologically detailed neurons. It is designed for high-performance computing (HPC) and supports vectorization and GPU acceleration.

tools.name: vibrant-tractography
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based visualization tool for tractography data
tools.detailed_description: A tool for visualizing diffusion MRI tractography data directly in a web browser, leveraging Rust and WebAssembly for performance.

tools.name: diluvian
tools.one_line_profile: Flood filling networks for segmenting neural tissue in EM data
tools.detailed_description: Diluvian provides deep learning methods for semi-automated segmentation of neuron structures in electron microscopy data using flood-filling networks.

tools.name: autoreject
tools.one_line_profile: Automated rejection and repair of bad trials/sensors in M/EEG
tools.detailed_description: Autoreject is a library for automatically handling bad channels and trials in Magnetoencephalography (MEG) and Electroencephalography (EEG) data, improving data quality for subsequent analysis.

tools.name: PyMNE.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia interface to MNE-Python via PythonCall
tools.detailed_description: PyMNE.jl provides a Julia interface to the MNE-Python library, allowing Julia users to leverage the extensive EEG/MEG analysis capabilities of MNE within the Julia ecosystem.

tools.name: EdMot
tools.one_line_profile: Edge Enhancement Approach for Motif-aware Community Detection
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the EdMot algorithm for community detection in graphs, which enhances edges based on motif structures to improve clustering performance.

tools.name: LabelPropagation
tools.one_line_profile: NetworkX implementation of Label Propagation for community detection
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Label Propagation algorithm for detecting community structures in large-scale networks, compatible with NetworkX.

tools.name: diff2vec
tools.one_line_profile: Implementation of Diffusion2Vec for graph embedding
tools.detailed_description: A reference implementation of the Diffusion2Vec algorithm, which leverages diffusion processes to generate node embeddings for graph analysis.

tools.name: Karate Club
tools.one_line_profile: Unsupervised machine learning on graphs
tools.detailed_description: Karate Club is a Python framework combining over 30 state-of-the-art graph mining algorithms for unsupervised learning, including node embedding, graph embedding, and community detection.

tools.name: Little Ball of Fur
tools.one_line_profile: Graph sampling extension library for NetworKit and NetworkX
tools.detailed_description: A library for sampling large graphs, providing various techniques (node, edge, exploration-based) to create representative subgraphs for analysis.

tools.name: netwulf
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive visualization of networks in Python
tools.detailed_description: Netwulf provides a simple API to interactively visualize networks from Python (NetworkX) using a web-based interface, allowing for layout adjustment and publication-quality figure generation.

tools.name: forceatlas2
tools.one_line_profile: Fast ForceAtlas2 graph layout algorithm for Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the ForceAtlas2 graph layout algorithm, optimized for speed and compatible with NetworkX, used for visualizing large networks.

tools.name: MRtrix3_connectome
tools.one_line_profile: BIDS App for generating subject connectomes using MRtrix3
tools.detailed_description: A BIDS App that encapsulates the MRtrix3 workflow to generate structural connectomes from raw BIDS-formatted diffusion MRI data.

tools.name: encode
tools.one_line_profile: Method for encoding brain connectomes in multidimensional arrays
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB tool for encoding brain connectomes into multidimensional tensors, facilitating advanced statistical analysis and machine learning on brain network data.

tools.name: Brain Connectivity Toolbox (BCT)
tools.one_line_profile: Complex network analysis of structural and functional brain connectivity datasets
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox providing a comprehensive set of measures and algorithms for characterizing brain connectivity, including segregation, integration, and centrality metrics. (Mirror/Distribution for Brainlife)

tools.name: BRAPH 2.0
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive software package for brain connectivity analysis and visualization
tools.detailed_description: BRAPH 2.0 is a MATLAB-based software package for graph theoretical analysis of brain connectivity. It supports various data modalities (MRI, fMRI, PET, EEG) and provides a GUI for pipeline management and visualization.

tools.name: Brian 2
tools.one_line_profile: Simulator for spiking neural networks
tools.detailed_description: Brian 2 is a simulator for spiking neural networks, designed to be easy to learn and use while remaining highly flexible and extensible. It allows users to define models using standard mathematical notation.

tools.name: brian2cuda
tools.one_line_profile: GPU acceleration extension for Brian 2 simulator
tools.detailed_description: An extension for the Brian 2 simulator that enables the simulation of spiking neural networks on NVIDIA GPUs using CUDA, significantly accelerating large-scale models.

tools.name: GraphSim
tools.one_line_profile: Graph similarity algorithms library based on NetworkX
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing various graph similarity algorithms (e.g., SimRank, HITS) built on top of NetworkX, useful for network analysis tasks.

tools.name: CanlabCore
tools.one_line_profile: Core object-oriented tools for neuroimaging analysis in MATLAB
tools.detailed_description: The core toolbox for the Canlab neuroimaging analysis suite, providing object-oriented structures for handling fMRI/PET data, statistical analysis, and visualization.

tools.name: CATMAID
tools.one_line_profile: Collaborative Annotation Toolkit for Massive Amounts of Image Data
tools.detailed_description: A web-based platform for collaborative annotation and tracing of neuronal structures in large-scale biological image data (e.g., EM connectomics).

tools.name: cluster_roi
tools.one_line_profile: Spatially constrained parcellation of functional MRI data
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool implementing the spatially constrained spectral clustering method for generating functional brain parcellations (Craddock Atlas) from fMRI data.

tools.name: meggie
tools.one_line_profile: GUI for MEG and EEG analysis based on MNE-python
tools.detailed_description: A user-friendly graphical interface for processing and analyzing MEG and EEG data, leveraging the MNE-python library for underlying computations.

tools.name: fmridenoise
tools.one_line_profile: Automated denoising and quality control for fMRI connectivity data
tools.detailed_description: A tool for automatic denoising of fMRI data, comparing different denoising strategies, and performing quality control for functional connectivity analyses.

tools.name: neuPrintExplorer
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based visualization tool for neuPrint connectomic data
tools.detailed_description: A web application for exploring and visualizing connectomic data stored in neuPrint databases, facilitating the analysis of neuronal circuits.

tools.name: Connectome Mapper 3
tools.one_line_profile: BIDS App for multi-modal connectome processing pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A BIDS App pipeline that processes anatomical, diffusion, fMRI, and EEG data to generate multi-resolution brain parcellations and connection matrices.

tools.name: cluster_tools
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed segmentation tools for bio-image analysis
tools.detailed_description: A library for running distributed segmentation workflows on biological image data, supporting various cluster environments.

tools.name: brainGraph
tools.one_line_profile: R package for graph theory analysis of brain MRI data
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing a pipeline for performing graph theory analysis on brain MRI data, including network construction, metric calculation, and visualization.

tools.name: PyNets
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for structural and functional connectome ensemble learning
tools.detailed_description: A reproducible workflow for generating structural and functional connectomes and applying ensemble learning techniques for analysis.

tools.name: COMMIT
tools.one_line_profile: Convex Optimization Modeling for Microstructure Informed Tractography
tools.detailed_description: A framework that combines tractography and tissue microstructure estimation from diffusion MRI using convex optimization to improve connectome accuracy.

tools.name: MASMAT
tools.one_line_profile: Multi Atlas Segmentation and Morphometric Analysis Toolkit for mouse brain
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for performing multi-atlas segmentation and morphometric analysis specifically designed for mouse brain MRI data.

tools.name: WebGL Brain Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based viewer for brain surface and tractography
tools.detailed_description: A WebGL-based application for visualizing brain surfaces and diffusion tractography data in a web browser.

tools.name: DeepGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Pandas-based network analysis library
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for analyzing data with networks, utilizing Pandas for efficient data handling and enabling graph-based analysis on tabular data.

tools.name: freesurferformats
tools.one_line_profile: R package for reading and writing neuroimaging file formats
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed to read and write various neuroimaging file formats, including those used by FreeSurfer, facilitating data interoperability in R.

tools.name: obonet
tools.one_line_profile: Library for parsing OBO-formatted ontologies into NetworkX
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that parses OBO-formatted ontologies (common in bioinformatics) and converts them into NetworkX graph objects for analysis.

tools.name: DIPY
tools.one_line_profile: Library for diffusion MRI and structural imaging analysis
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python library for the analysis of diffusion MRI, including tractography, reconstruction, registration, and statistical analysis of medical images.

tools.name: Trekker
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel transport tractography for dMRI
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance tool for fiber tracking (tractography) using the parallel transport framework on diffusion MRI data.

tools.name: AutomatedWellLogCorrelation
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for automated well log correlation using CNNs
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning framework designed to correlate geological well logs by generating feature vectors via Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) in PyTorch, facilitating automated stratigraphic correlation.

tools.name: CATO
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for structural and functional brain connectivity reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox designed for the reconstruction of structural and functional brain connectivity matrices from MRI data, supporting various processing steps for connectome analysis.

tools.name: nxviz
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization package for NetworkX graphs
tools.detailed_description: A graph visualization library built on top of NetworkX and matplotlib, providing rational and aesthetic graph layouts (like Circos plots, Matrix plots, Arc plots) specifically for network analysis.

tools.name: DunedinPACNI
tools.one_line_profile: Estimator for DunedinPACNI brain aging scores
tools.detailed_description: A tool to estimate DunedinPACNI (Pace of Aging Calculated from NeuroImaging) scores from FreeSurfer parcellations of brain MRI data, serving as a specific biomarker calculator.

tools.name: SlicerParcellation
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning brain segmentation modules for 3D Slicer
tools.detailed_description: A set of modules for the 3D Slicer medical image computing platform, enabling deep learning-based brain segmentation and parcellation directly within the Slicer environment.

tools.name: FieldTrip
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for MEG, EEG, and iEEG analysis
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive MATLAB toolbox for the analysis of non-invasive and invasive electrophysiological data (MEG, EEG, iEEG), covering preprocessing, spectral analysis, source reconstruction, and connectivity analysis.

tools.name: JSNetworkX
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript graph analysis library ported from NetworkX
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for the creation, manipulation, and study of the structure, dynamics, and functions of complex networks, enabling network analysis directly in web-based scientific applications.

tools.name: DSI Studio
tools.one_line_profile: Tractography and diffusion MRI analysis tool
tools.detailed_description: A tractography software tool for diffusion MRI analysis, mapping brain connections and fiber pathways using diffusion spectrum imaging (DSI) and other diffusion techniques.

tools.name: null_models_net_neurosci
tools.one_line_profile: Null models for network neuroscience
tools.detailed_description: A collection of code implementing various null models for statistical testing in network neuroscience, allowing researchers to compare empirical brain networks against random baselines.

tools.name: OSMnx
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to analyze street networks from OpenStreetMap
tools.detailed_description: A Python package to download, model, project, visualize, and analyze real-world street networks and other geospatial geometries from OpenStreetMap data.

tools.name: FetalBrainParcellation
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic segmentation tool for fetal brain MRI
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed by the GIFT-Surg group for the automatic segmentation and parcellation of fetal brain 3D T2-weighted MRI scans.

tools.name: SOFIMA
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable Optical Flow-based Image Montaging and Alignment
tools.detailed_description: A scalable tool for stitching and aligning large-scale microscopy datasets (e.g., for connectomics) using optical flow methods, developed by Google Research.

tools.name: Flood-Filling Networks (FFN)
tools.one_line_profile: Instance segmentation for 3D volumes using flood-filling networks
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning method and tool for automated instance segmentation of neurons in 3D electron microscopy volumes, widely used in connectomics.

tools.name: PyGraphistry
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated graph visualization and analysis library
tools.detailed_description: A Python library to load, shape, embed, and explore large graphs using GPU acceleration, integrating with the Graphistry visual analytics platform.

tools.name: nn-decoding
tools.one_line_profile: Brain decoding/encoding with neural network language models
tools.detailed_description: A framework for brain decoding and encoding tasks using neural network language models, facilitating research into the relationship between brain activity and language processing.

tools.name: TemporalNetworkAccessibility
tools.one_line_profile: Library for temporal network analysis and adjacency matrix sequences
tools.detailed_description: A library providing classes and methods for handling adjacency matrix sequences and temporal network edgelists, useful for analyzing time-varying network accessibility.

tools.name: hvPlot
tools.one_line_profile: High-level plotting API for data science ecosystem
tools.detailed_description: A high-level plotting API built on HoloViews that provides a general and powerful visualization interface for pandas, dask, xarray, and networkx, widely used in scientific data exploration.

tools.name: BolT
tools.one_line_profile: Fused Window Transformers for fMRI Time Series Analysis
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the BolT (BOLD Transformer) model, a fused window transformer architecture designed specifically for analyzing fMRI time series data to extract functional connectivity features.

tools.name: FDB
tools.one_line_profile: Fourier-constrained diffusion bridges for MRI reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: Official implementation of the Fourier-constrained diffusion bridges (FDB) model, a method for solving inverse problems in MRI reconstruction using diffusion models.

tools.name: SSDiffRecon
tools.one_line_profile: Self-Supervised Diffusion Model for MRI Reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: Official implementation of a Self-Supervised Diffusion Model designed for MRI reconstruction tasks, enabling high-quality image recovery without fully sampled ground truth.

tools.name: BraTS2018-tumor-segmentation
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning models for brain tumor segmentation
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of DeepMedic and 3D UNet architectures specifically optimized for brain tumor segmentation tasks on the BraTS 2018 dataset, integrating location information with brain parcellation.

tools.name: neurofire
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning toolkit for connectomics datasets
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit designed for applying deep learning methods to connectomics datasets, facilitating segmentation and analysis of neural structures.

tools.name: DeepTract
tools.one_line_profile: Probabilistic Deep Learning Framework for White Matter Fiber Tractography
tools.detailed_description: A probabilistic deep learning framework for white matter fiber tractography, providing a data-driven approach to estimate fiber orientation distributions.

tools.name: FiberApp
tools.one_line_profile: Software for tracking and analyzing fibrous objects
tools.detailed_description: A software tool designed for tracking and analyzing biomacromolecules, polymers, filaments, and fibrous objects, applicable in biophysics and materials science.

tools.name: DVID
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed, Versioned, Image-oriented Dataservice for connectomics
tools.detailed_description: A distributed, versioned, image-oriented data service designed to handle massive connectomics datasets, supporting efficient storage and retrieval for reconstruction pipelines.

tools.name: connect_metrics
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB code for brain connectivity graph theory
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox for calculating brain connectivity graph theory metrics, built as an extension to the Brain Connectivity Toolbox.

tools.name: QSNNs
tools.one_line_profile: Quantization-aware training for spiking neural networks
tools.detailed_description: A library for quantization-aware training of spiking neural networks (SNNs), facilitating the deployment of efficient neuromorphic models.

tools.name: snnTorch
tools.one_line_profile: Deep and online learning with spiking neural networks
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for deep and online learning with spiking neural networks (SNNs), integrating with PyTorch to enable gradient-based training of spiking models.

tools.name: network-visualization
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive network visualization tool
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based application for interactive visualization of networks and graphs using NetworkX, Plotly, and Dash, suitable for exploring connectivity data.

tools.name: DTI-process-analysis
tools.one_line_profile: Preprocess and analyze DTI medical images
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolkit for preprocessing and analyzing 3D Diffusion Tensor Imaging (DTI) data, supporting standard processing pipelines.

tools.name: matplotlib-multilayer-network
tools.one_line_profile: Template for visualizing multilayer networks
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight utility for creating and visualizing multilayer networks using Matplotlib and NetworkX, useful for complex brain network visualization.

tools.name: AgentPy
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for agent-based modeling
tools.detailed_description: An open-source framework for the development, simulation, and analysis of agent-based models (ABM) in Python, applicable to complex systems and computational neuroscience.

tools.name: niseq
tools.one_line_profile: Group sequential tests for neuroimaging
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing group sequential testing methods specifically for neuroimaging data analysis, allowing for interim analyses and stopping rules.

tools.name: along-tract-stats
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for along-tract analysis of DTI tractography
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox for performing statistical analysis along the length of white matter tracts derived from DTI MRI tractography data.

tools.name: Segregated-Dendrite-Deep-Learning
tools.one_line_profile: Spiking neural network with segregated dendrites
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a deep learning model within a spiking neural network architecture that utilizes segregated dendrites for enhanced processing capabilities.

tools.name: networkx_viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive GUI for NetworkX graphs
tools.detailed_description: A graphical user interface for visualizing and interacting with NetworkX graph objects, facilitating the exploration of graph structures.

tools.name: FastFC
tools.one_line_profile: Fast Functional Connectivity Toolbox
tools.detailed_description: A C++ toolbox designed for the rapid computation of functional connectivity metrics from neuroimaging data.

tools.name: rteeg
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time EEG streaming and analysis module
tools.detailed_description: A Python module for streaming and analyzing EEG data in real-time, suitable for brain-computer interface (BCI) applications and monitoring.

tools.name: scattr
tools.one_line_profile: BIDS app for structural connectivity
tools.detailed_description: A BIDS App designed to compute structural connectivity matrices between targeted brain regions using diffusion MRI data.

tools.name: learnpool
tools.one_line_profile: Learnable Pooling in Graph Convolution Networks for Brain Surface Analysis
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a learnable pooling mechanism in Graph Convolutional Networks (GCNs) specifically tailored for brain surface analysis tasks.

tools.name: conan
tools.one_line_profile: Connectivity Analysis tools in Matlab
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox providing a suite of tools for analyzing brain connectivity data, including graph theoretical metrics and visualization.

tools.name: KNOSSOS
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization and annotation tool for 3D neural data
tools.detailed_description: A software tool for the visualization and annotation of 3D image data, developed for the rapid reconstruction of neural morphology and connectivity.

tools.name: erwin
tools.one_line_profile: Quantitative MRI toolbox
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolbox for quantitative MRI analysis, providing tools for processing and estimating quantitative parameters from MRI data.

tools.name: cGCN_fMRI
tools.one_line_profile: Graph Convolution Network for fMRI Analysis
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a Graph Convolution Network (GCN) based on connectivity neighborhoods for the analysis of fMRI data.

tools.name: VideoFiberTrack
tools.one_line_profile: Fiber tracking for Particle Tracking Velocity experiments
tools.detailed_description: A tool for tracking fibers in video data, specifically designed for Particle Tracking Velocity (PTV) experiments in rheology and related studies.

tools.name: WheatNNLeek
tools.one_line_profile: Spiking neural network system
tools.detailed_description: A system for simulating spiking neural networks, implemented in Rust for performance.

tools.name: lans
tools.one_line_profile: Likelihood Approximation Networks for cognitive neuroscience
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of Likelihood Approximation Networks (LANs) for fast inference of simulation models in cognitive neuroscience.

tools.name: FiberStars
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization tool for comparing dMRI data
tools.detailed_description: A visualization tool designed for comparing diffusion MRI (dMRI) data across multiple subjects, facilitating group analysis and quality control.

tools.name: csg_mri_pipelines
tools.one_line_profile: MRI preprocessing and analysis pipelines for disorders of consciousness
tools.detailed_description: A collection of MRI preprocessing and analysis pipelines developed by the Coma Science Group, specifically tailored for studying disorders of consciousness.

tools.name: dyconnmap
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic connectome mapping module
tools.detailed_description: A Python module for dynamic functional connectivity analysis, offering various algorithms to estimate and analyze dynamic brain networks.

tools.name: QMRITools
tools.one_line_profile: Processing and visualization tools for quantitative MRI data
tools.detailed_description: A toolbox for processing and visualizing quantitative MRI (qMRI) data, including diffusion, perfusion, and structural MRI analysis.

tools.name: BrainNet Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Brain network visualization tool
tools.detailed_description: A graph-theoretical network visualization tool for mapping and displaying structural and functional connectivity patterns in the brain.

tools.name: MNE-BIDS
tools.one_line_profile: BIDS data handling for MNE-Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that facilitates reading and writing BIDS-compatible electrophysiological datasets using MNE-Python.

tools.name: MNE-BIDS-Pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Automated processing pipeline for MNE-BIDS datasets
tools.detailed_description: A full-pipeline solution for processing electrophysiological data (MEG/EEG) formatted in BIDS, from raw data to source estimation and statistics.

tools.name: mne-connectivity
tools.one_line_profile: Connectivity analysis tools for MNE-Python
tools.detailed_description: A library for computing functional and effective connectivity measures (coherence, Granger causality, etc.) on MEG/EEG data.

tools.name: mne-denoise
tools.one_line_profile: Narrow-band artefact removal for MNE
tools.detailed_description: A tool tailored for MNE-Python workflows to suppress power-line noise and other oscillatory contaminants using harmonic regression techniques.

tools.name: MNE-HCP
tools.one_line_profile: Human Connectome Project MEG data processing
tools.detailed_description: A library for reading and processing MEG data from the Human Connectome Project (HCP) using MNE-Python.

tools.name: mne-hfo
tools.one_line_profile: High-frequency oscillation detection
tools.detailed_description: A library for estimating and computing high-frequency oscillations (HFOs) from iEEG data, compatible with BIDS and MNE.

tools.name: mne-lsl
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time brain signal streaming framework
tools.detailed_description: A framework for real-time brain signal streaming (Lab Streaming Layer) integrated with MNE-Python for online processing.

tools.name: MNE-Python
tools.one_line_profile: Magnetoencephalography and Electroencephalography analysis
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive open-source Python package for exploring, visualizing, and analyzing human neurophysiological data (MEG, EEG, sEEG, ECoG, fNIRS).

tools.name: mne-qt-browser
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance 2D data browser for MNE
tools.detailed_description: A fast, Qt-based backend for visualizing 2D electrophysiological data within MNE-Python, offering improved performance over matplotlib.

tools.name: mne-r
tools.one_line_profile: R interface for MNE-Python
tools.detailed_description: A package providing fast access to MNE-Python functionality from within the R environment, enabling cross-language workflows.

tools.name: mne-realtime
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time data analysis with MNE-Python
tools.detailed_description: A module for real-time data analysis and feedback using MNE-Python, supporting various data clients.

tools.name: mne-rsa
tools.one_line_profile: Representational Similarity Analysis for MEG/EEG
tools.detailed_description: A library for performing Representational Similarity Analysis (RSA) on MEG and EEG data to study information representations in the brain.

tools.name: PyDesigner
tools.one_line_profile: Diffusion MRI preprocessing pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A hands-free preprocessing pipeline for DTI, DKI, FBI, and FBWM, streamlining the analysis of diffusion MRI data.

tools.name: fafbseg
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis support for Drosophila connectomes
tools.detailed_description: A tool within the natverse ecosystem providing support functions for the analysis of Drosophila connectomes, specifically for FAFB and FlyWire datasets.

tools.name: nat
tools.one_line_profile: NeuroAnatomy Toolbox
tools.detailed_description: The core package of the natverse ecosystem for the 3D visualisation and analysis of biological image data, focusing on single neuron tracings.

tools.name: rcatmaid
tools.one_line_profile: R interface for CATMAID
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing API access to the CATMAID web image annotation tool, facilitating programmatic interaction with connectomics data.

tools.name: skeletor
tools.one_line_profile: Library for extracting 3D skeletons from mesh objects
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to extract 3D skeletons from mesh objects, specifically useful for neuron morphology analysis and thinning of 3D shapes.

tools.name: netneurotools
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of tools for network neuroscience analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python package containing various utility functions and tools used by the Network Neuroscience Lab, facilitating graph theory analysis and brain network processing.

tools.name: Lead-DBS
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for Deep Brain Stimulation electrode localization
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox for localizing Deep Brain Stimulation (DBS) electrodes and performing connectomic analyses based on electrode placement.

tools.name: NetworkX
tools.one_line_profile: Fundamental library for graph theory and complex network analysis
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python package for the creation, manipulation, and study of the structure, dynamics, and functions of complex networks, widely used in connectomics.

tools.name: ConvRNN Model Zoo
tools.one_line_profile: Pre-trained convolutional recurrent neural networks for neuroscience
tools.detailed_description: A collection of ImageNet pre-trained convolutional recurrent neural network models, designed for use in computational neuroscience research to model visual processing.

tools.name: TNN
tools.one_line_profile: Biologically-realistic recurrent convolutional neural networks
tools.detailed_description: A library for building and training biologically-realistic recurrent convolutional neural networks, bridging deep learning and neuroscience models.

tools.name: dFC
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic Functional Connectivity assessment methods
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of several well-known methods for assessing dynamic Functional Connectivity (dFC) in neuroimaging data.

tools.name: Surf Ice
tools.one_line_profile: GLSL surface rendering tool for neuroimaging
tools.detailed_description: A visualization tool for surface rendering of neuroimaging data, supporting various mesh formats (GIfTI, FreeSurfer, etc.) and tractography formats.

tools.name: kwyk
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian brain parcellation tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool for Bayesian brain parcellation ('Knowing What You Know'), providing probabilistic segmentation of brain structures.

tools.name: ephypype
tools.one_line_profile: Electrophysiology analysis pipelines
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing pipelines for electrophysiology (EEG/MEG) analysis, designed to work with Nipype and Graphpype.

tools.name: nilearn
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning for NeuroImaging in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python module for fast and easy statistical learning on NeuroImaging data, leveraging scikit-learn for multivariate analysis, decoding, and connectivity analysis.

tools.name: eddymotion
tools.one_line_profile: Eddy-current and head-motion correction for dMRI
tools.detailed_description: An open-source tool for correcting eddy currents and head motion in diffusion MRI data, developed by the NiPreps community.

tools.name: brainx
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for analysis of brain imaging-derived networks
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for analyzing brain networks derived from imaging data, built on top of NetworkX.

tools.name: multiNetX
tools.one_line_profile: Manipulation and visualization of multilayer networks
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for the creation, manipulation, and visualization of multilayer networks, extending NetworkX capabilities.

tools.name: REACT
tools.one_line_profile: Receptor-Enriched Analysis of functional Connectivity by Targets
tools.detailed_description: A tool for enriching functional connectivity analysis with receptor density maps, allowing for multimodal analysis of fMRI and PET/atlas data.

tools.name: netgraph
tools.one_line_profile: Publication-quality network visualisations in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for creating high-quality, customizable visualizations of networks and graphs, suitable for scientific publications.

tools.name: NiChord
tools.one_line_profile: Chord diagram visualization for brain networks
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for visualizing functional connectivity and brain networks using chord diagrams, aiding in the interpretation of connectomic data.

tools.name: prioritizr
tools.one_line_profile: Systematic conservation prioritization tool
tools.detailed_description: An R package for solving systematic conservation planning problems using integer linear programming (ILP), allowing users to build and solve prioritization models.

tools.name: PyTorch Geometric
tools.one_line_profile: Graph Neural Network Library for PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A geometric deep learning extension library for PyTorch, providing primitives for building Graph Neural Networks (GNNs), widely used in scientific graph analysis.

tools.name: graynet
tools.one_line_profile: Extraction of subject-wise networks from structural MRI
tools.detailed_description: A tool for extracting single-subject morphological networks from structural MRI features (like cortical thickness, curvature) for connectomic analysis.

tools.name: neuropredict
tools.one_line_profile: Assessment of predictive power for neuroimaging features
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive tool for assessing the predictive power of various neuroimaging features and biomarkers using machine learning cross-validation frameworks.

tools.name: conn_tools
tools.one_line_profile: Utilities for CONN Toolbox results extraction
tools.detailed_description: A collection of MATLAB tools for extracting and plotting second-level ROI-to-ROI results from the CONN functional connectivity toolbox.

tools.name: hcp-utils
tools.one_line_profile: Utilities for handling Human Connectome Project (HCP) data with Nilearn
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight Python library designed to facilitate the loading, visualization, and manipulation of neuroimaging data from the Human Connectome Project (HCP), integrating seamlessly with Nilearn and other neuroimaging tools.

tools.name: gravis
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive graph visualization library for Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for creating interactive graph visualizations within web browsers, Jupyter notebooks, and other HTML environments, supporting various graph formats including NetworkX and igraph, useful for connectome visualization.

tools.name: GraphRicciCurvature
tools.one_line_profile: Library to compute graph Ricci curvature and Ricci flow
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for computing discrete Ricci curvature and Ricci flow on networks, providing topological metrics for analyzing complex networks such as brain connectomes.

tools.name: GRETNA
tools.one_line_profile: Graph-theoretical Network Analysis Toolkit for brain imaging
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based toolbox for analyzing the topology of brain networks, supporting various graph-theoretical metrics and preprocessing steps for fMRI and dMRI data.

tools.name: webknossos
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based visualization and annotation tool for large 3D datasets
tools.detailed_description: A platform for visualizing, sharing, and annotating large-scale 3D image data, particularly suited for electron microscopy connectomics and collaborative neuron tracing.

tools.name: TrackToLearn
tools.one_line_profile: Deep reinforcement learning framework for tractography
tools.detailed_description: A framework for training and evaluating deep reinforcement learning agents for tractography in diffusion MRI, enabling the reconstruction of white matter pathways.

tools.name: TractoFlow
tools.one_line_profile: Robust diffusion MRI processing pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A Nextflow-based pipeline for processing diffusion MRI data, handling steps from raw data to tractography, ensuring reproducibility and scalability via Singularity containers.

tools.name: cloud-volume
tools.one_line_profile: IO library for reading and writing Neuroglancer datasets
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for programmatically reading and writing large-scale volumetric data in Neuroglancer precomputed format, essential for handling massive connectomics datasets.

tools.name: euclidean-distance-transform-3d
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Euclidean distance transform library
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library (with Python bindings) for computing Euclidean distance transforms and signed distance transforms on multi-label 3D anisotropic images, used in segmentation processing.

tools.name: fpzip
tools.one_line_profile: Floating point image compression algorithm bindings
tools.detailed_description: Cython bindings for the fpzip algorithm, enabling efficient compression of floating-point 3D image data, commonly used in scientific imaging and connectomics.

tools.name: igneous
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable processing tools for Neuroglancer datasets
tools.detailed_description: A collection of tools for scalable downsampling, meshing, skeletonizing, and contrast normalization of large volumetric datasets, compatible with Neuroglancer and CloudVolume.

tools.name: kimimaro
tools.one_line_profile: Skeletonization library for 3D image segmentations
tools.detailed_description: A tool to skeletonize densely labeled 3D image segmentations using the TEASAR algorithm, facilitating the analysis of neuronal morphology in connectomics.

tools.name: zmesh
tools.one_line_profile: Marching Cubes and mesh simplification library
tools.detailed_description: A library for generating meshes from multi-label 3D images using Marching Cubes and performing mesh simplification, optimized for large-scale connectomics data.

tools.name: brainconn
tools.one_line_profile: R package for visualising brain connectivity data
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed for plotting brain connectivity matrices and graphs in 2D and interactive 3D formats, aiding in the visualization of connectome data.

tools.name: eeg-pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: End-to-End EEG processing pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based pipeline for EEG data processing, including cleaning, filtering, ICA, and decoding analysis, built on top of MNE-Python.

tools.name: StellarGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Machine Learning on Graphs library
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for machine learning on graphs and networks, providing implementations of state-of-the-art algorithms for graph classification, node embedding, and link prediction, widely used in scientific graph analysis.

tools.name: python-louvain
tools.one_line_profile: Louvain Community Detection library
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Louvain algorithm for community detection in graphs, essential for identifying modular structures in brain networks and other complex systems.

tools.name: synthetic
tools.one_line_profile: Symbolic Generators for Complex Networks
tools.detailed_description: A tool for generating synthetic complex networks using symbolic generators, useful for benchmarking and simulation in network science and connectomics.

tools.name: tvb-recon
tools.one_line_profile: Reconstruction pipeline for The Virtual Brain models
tools.detailed_description: A set of tools and scripts for processing anatomical MRI scans to create personalized brain models compatible with The Virtual Brain (TVB) simulation platform.

tools.name: Tractor
tools.one_line_profile: R package for reading, manipulating, and visualizing magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) and tractography data
tools.detailed_description: Tractor is a package for the R statistical environment that provides functions for reading, writing, and manipulating magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) data, with a particular focus on diffusion MRI and tractography. It allows for the analysis of white matter tracts and structural connectivity.

tools.name: UNI-EM
tools.one_line_profile: Unified environment for DNN-based automated segmentation of neuronal EM images
tools.detailed_description: UNI-EM is a unified environment designed for the automated segmentation of neuronal electron microscopy (EM) images using deep neural networks. It facilitates the processing pipeline for connectomics research, enabling efficient reconstruction of neuronal structures.

tools.name: Teneto
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for the analysis of temporal networks in neuroscience
tools.detailed_description: Teneto is a Python library dedicated to the analysis of temporal networks, particularly focusing on time-varying connectivity in neuroimaging data (e.g., fMRI). It provides measures for quantifying dynamic network properties and tools for temporal network visualization.

tools.name: mne-microstates
tools.one_line_profile: Microstate analysis tool for electrophysiological data compatible with MNE-Python
tools.detailed_description: mne-microstates is a Python library for performing microstate analysis on EEG/MEG data. It integrates seamlessly with the MNE-Python ecosystem, allowing researchers to cluster scalp topographies into functional microstates.

tools.name: BrainGNN_Pytorch
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch implementation of Graph Neural Networks for brain network analysis
tools.detailed_description: This repository provides a PyTorch implementation of BrainGNN, a graph neural network framework designed for analyzing brain connectivity networks (fMRI/DTI). It includes ROI-aware graph convolutional layers and pooling mechanisms for neuroimaging biomarkers.

tools.name: SSDiffRecon
tools.one_line_profile: Self-supervised diffusion models for MRI reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: SSDiffRecon is a TensorFlow implementation of self-supervised MRI reconstruction using unrolled diffusion models. It enables high-quality image reconstruction from under-sampled MRI data without requiring fully sampled ground truth during training.

tools.name: ArteryNetwork
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for extracting and analyzing brain artery networks from MRI
tools.detailed_description: ArteryNetwork is a pipeline designed to extract vessel structures from Magnetic Resonance Images (MRI) and perform network analysis. It is specifically tailored for tracking adaptation and compensation processes in brain arterial networks, such as in patients with glioblastoma.

tools.name: mneflow
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning framework for EEG/MEG decoding using MNE-Python and TensorFlow
tools.detailed_description: mneflow is a Python library that provides a bridge between MNE-Python and TensorFlow for deep learning analysis of EEG and MEG data. It facilitates the development and training of neural networks for decoding cognitive states and processing neurophysiological signals.
